body_html:
I did a little more digging. Basically the stack of the abort is as follows:

"aten/src/ATen/Context.cpp" argErrorHandler 30
aten/src/TH/THGeneral.cpp:122 _THArgCheck
generic/THTensorMath.cpp:2239 THFloatTensor_addbmm
_cpulib.c:588 _cffi_f_bad_func
at torch/csrc/Module.cpp:149 THPModule_safeCall

the module extension is called with a bad argument and the _THArgCheck throwsn runtime exception. But the exception never gets propagated back to python. I even tried to add -fexceptions flag to the compile arguments at : https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/utils/ffi/__init__.py#L179 but that did not help.

The other thing I tried was to add a try/catch block to

pytorch/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorMath.cpp

Line 2235 in 7c70c3b

void THTensor_(addbmm)(THTensor *result, real beta, THTensor *t, real alpha, THTensor *batch1, THTensor *batch2)
and that eliminated the abort , but the test still fails because I am not setting the torch.FatalError correctly. And that may not be the correct way to fix this anyway.

@soumith @apaszke Any pointers to how this can fixed is appreciated.
body_text:
I did a little more digging.  Basically the stack of the abort is as follows:
"aten/src/ATen/Context.cpp"   argErrorHandler  30
aten/src/TH/THGeneral.cpp:122    _THArgCheck
generic/THTensorMath.cpp:2239 THFloatTensor_addbmm
_cpulib.c:588  _cffi_f_bad_func
at torch/csrc/Module.cpp:149  THPModule_safeCall
the module extension is called with a bad argument and the _THArgCheck throwsn runtime exception.  But the exception never gets propagated back to python.    I even tried to add -fexceptions flag to the compile arguments at :  https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/utils/ffi/__init__.py#L179    but that did not help.
The other thing I tried was to add a try/catch block to 
  
    
      pytorch/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorMath.cpp
    
    
         Line 2235
      in
      7c70c3b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           void THTensor_(addbmm)(THTensor *result, real beta, THTensor *t, real alpha, THTensor *batch1, THTensor *batch2) 
        
    
  

  and that eliminated the abort , but the test still fails because I am not setting the torch.FatalError correctly.  And that may not be the correct way to fix this anyway.
@soumith @apaszke Any pointers to how this can fixed is appreciated.
body:
I did a little more digging.  Basically the stack of the abort is as follows:

"aten/src/ATen/Context.cpp"   argErrorHandler  30
 aten/src/TH/THGeneral.cpp:122    _THArgCheck
generic/THTensorMath.cpp:2239 THFloatTensor_addbmm
_cpulib.c:588  _cffi_f_bad_func
at torch/csrc/Module.cpp:149  THPModule_safeCall

the module extension is called with a bad argument and the _THArgCheck throwsn runtime exception.  But the exception never gets propagated back to python.    I even tried to add -fexceptions flag to the compile arguments at :  https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/utils/ffi/__init__.py#L179    but that did not help.   

The other thing I tried was to add a try/catch block to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/7c70c3bdca149918e7c410e75b374e546cb5f52d/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorMath.cpp#L2235  and that eliminated the abort , but the test still fails because I am not setting the torch.FatalError correctly.  And that may not be the correct way to fix this anyway.

@soumith @apaszke Any pointers to how this can fixed is appreciated.
